column4: Is it possible to "upgrade" from a running 32-bit install to 64-bit?
So reinstall? Can I debootsrap a 64-bit from a running 32-bit install then?
debootstrap i know is stable for debian.. i dont know for ubuntu
if u not using power hungry or more than a gig ram.. u wont see any difference going 64bit
CPU is 2x quad core X3210 there is like 8GB RAM
i say keep the 32bit in case
dunno.. in case u need an app that wont run on the 64bit..
this box runs vbox headless, if I would like to run skype on it, I would run it inside a vm
vbox cant be run headless .. what u saying?
I controll the VMs via RDC
